str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead into, bring in, announce. From eis and phero; to carry inward.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be over-anxious; with acc: To be anxious about, distracted; I care for. From merimna; to be anxious about.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
